entities.name: GENERAL DATA PROTECTION REGULATION
entities.description: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy in the European Union (EU) and the European Economic Area (EEA), which also addresses the transfer of personal data outside the EU and EEA areas.

entities.name: EUROPEAN UNION
entities.description: The European Union (EU) is a political and economic union of 27 member states that are located primarily in Europe. It has adopted the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) governing the strict handling of personal data.

entities.name: UNITED KINGDOM
entities.description: The United Kingdom has adopted the U.K. GDPR, governing the strict handling of personal data of persons within the United Kingdom, including its use and protection.

entities.name: UNITED STATES
entities.description: The United States is a country that may not protect products or IP rights to the same extent as some foreign laws, and is also involved in data transfer issues.

relationships.relationship_description: The European Union adopted the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
The United Kingdom adopted the U.K. GDPR, which is a version of the GDPR governing the strict handling of personal data of persons within the United Kingdom.
